text:
We are running apache version 1.3.14 and jakarta-tomcat version 3.2.1-3 RPM
installed on linux. We have found that over time the response time of the web
server degrades to a point in which our website takes about a minute to load our
home page. Over a 24 hour period we notice the response time going from 35
millisecond to 300 milliseconds. Once we restart tomcat the response time
returns to 35 millisends. We have tested the response time running just apache
servering a static html page and the response time is a consant 20 milliseconds.
Our testing of running tomcat has been with our servlets and without (just
running a sinple jsp page) and both degrade at the same levels.
creator: jcomeau@caldera.com
Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
text:
I'm marking this bug as WONTFIX because there will be no further development
on Tomcat 3.2.1.  The current 3.2.x release is Tomcat 3.2.3. Please try this
release and see if this problem is still present.  There was a lot of bug
fixes, so maybe one of them impacted this problem.  Open a new bug if the
problem is still present in Tomcat 3.2.3, or perhaps Tomcat 3.3 if you want
to give it a try.

Note: There are some serious security vulerabilities in Tomcat 3.2.1, so
upgrading is highly recommended.

creator: jcomeau@caldera.com
text:
We have re-tested with Tomcat 3.2.3 and have the same issue. The response time
in a 24 hour period goes from about 35 milliseconds to 300 milliseconds for a
simple jsp page.

Most likely related with the use of sessions. If you use "ab" to test, and the
JSP page uses session ( default is true - you must specify a directive to
disable), then the performance will slowly go down as more sessions are active.
 However, if you let it "rest" for some time the sessions should expire and be
garbage collected and the performance should go back to normal.

I tried to run for few hours and doesn't seem to be a problem. If you can, try
to add 2 more jsp pages to your test: one showing the memory use, and the other
doing a System.gc() and see if the performance go back to normal. 

Please try in 3.3, as a lot of GC-collection code has been fixed. If the problem
is still there, please let us know - this should be fixed before the final
release.
creator: cmanolache@yahoo.com

text:
Since there isn't enough information here to make a diagnosis, and since
Costin wasn't able to duplicate it, I'm going to resolve this as "INVALID".
It likely wouldn't be fixed in Tomcat 3.2.x anyway.

Please try Tomcat 3.3 and see if this behavior is still present.  If so, open
a new bug.  Note that simply saying that the response time slows down over
time doesn't give us much to go on as far as diagnosing the problem.
creator: Larry.Isaacs@sas.com
